net.nicholaswilliams.java.licensing.licensor.interfaces.text.abstraction
Class AbstractTextInterfaceDevice

java.lang.Object
  net.nicholaswilliams.java.licensing.licensor.interfaces.abstraction.AbstractPasswordPrompter
      net.nicholaswilliams.java.licensing.licensor.interfaces.text.abstraction.AbstractTextInterfaceDevice
All Implemented Interfaces:
Flushable, OutputDevice, PasswordPrompter, TextInterfaceDevice
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConsoleInterfaceDevice
public abstract class AbstractTextInterfaceDevice
extends AbstractPasswordPrompter
implements TextInterfaceDevice, PasswordPrompter, OutputDevice

An abstract implementation of TextInterfaceDevice that implements any common utilities among all interface devices.

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Nick Williams

Method Detail

exit

public void exit()
Terminates the currently running application normally (with a status code of zero). Equivalent to calling (and, if fact, calls) TextInterfaceDevice.exit(int) with an exitCode of 0.

Specified by:
exit in interface TextInterfaceDevice

promptForValidPassword

public char[] promptForValidPassword(int minLength,
                                     int maxLength,
                                     String what)
                              throws IOError
Prompts for a valid password by asking for the password using PasswordPrompter.readPassword(String, Object...), checking its length against the constraints, asking for the password to be confirmed, and checking to make sure the passwords match.

This method should continue to ask for the password over and over again until a valid password is entered and confirmed or the user cancels the operation.

Specified by:
promptForValidPassword in interface PasswordPrompter
Parameters:
minLength - The minimum legal length for the password
maxLength - The maximum legal length for the password
what - What we're prompting for a password for
Returns:
the valid, confirmed password entered by the user.
Throws:
IOError - if an I/O error occurs.
